results.name: GDACS Orange: Philippines EQ Magnitude 6.7M, Depth:10km
results.summary: On 8/18/2020 12:03:48 AM, an earthquake occurred in Philippines potentially affecting 2570000 people within 100km. The earthquake had Magnitude 6.7M, Depth:10km.

field_reports.description:
On 18 August 2020 at 10:03:45 am local time, 6.7 magnitude earthquake struck near Cataingan, Masbate province. The earthquake, which was tectonic in nature was reported at a depth of 10 km.
Intensities reported in the following areas:
Intensity VII - Cataingan, Masbate
Intensity V - City of Masbate, Masbate; Almagro, and Tagapul-an, Samar;
Intensity IV - Palanas, and San Jacinto, Masbate; City of Sorsogon, Sorsogon; City of Legazpi, Albay; San Andres, Quezon; Mapanas, and Palapag, Northern
Samar; Barugo, Dagami, Dulag, Julita, La Paz, Palo, and Tanauan, Leyte; City of Sagay, Negros Occidental
Intensity III - City of Baybay, Isabel, Javier, and Kananga, Leyte; Ormoc City; Mulanay, Quezon; City of Iloilo
Intensity II - Guinayangan and Lopez, Quezon; President Roxas, Capiz; Patnongon, Patnongon, San Jose de Buenavista, and Tibiao, Antique
Intensity I - Lezo, Aklan; City of Dumaguete, Negros Oriental

Instrumental Intensities:
Intensity V - Masbate City, Masbate
Intensity IV - Palo, Leyte; City of Iloilo; City of Roxas, Capiz; Naval, Biliran;
Intensity III - City of Bago, Negros Occidental; Malinao, Aklan; Pandan, Antique; Jamindan, Capiz; Ormoc City
Intensity II - Gumaca, Quezon; San Jose de Buenavista, Antique; City of Sipalay, Negros Occidental; Valderrama, Antique; Sipocot, Camarines Sur; Talibon,
Bohol; San Francisco, Cebu
Intensity I - Malay, Aklan; City of Gingoog, Misamis Oriental

Based on  PHIVOLCS , damage and aftershocks are expected.
Based on GDACS, the earthquake is expected to have a medium humanitarian impact based on the magnitude and the affected population and their vulnerability.

At 08:03 AM Philippine Standard Time (PST) of 18 Aug 2020 (Tuesday), a strong Magnitude (Mw) 6.6 earthquake shook the province of Masbate and vicinity. The earthquake has an epicenter located 7 kilometers S29°E of Cataingan (Masbate) and a depth of 21 kilometers. As of 4:00 AM, 19 August 2020, 218 aftershocks ranging from M 1.6 to M 4.4 were recorded, 108 of which were plotted, and five were felt(Figure 1).

The 18 August 2020 M6.6 earthquake was felt with a maximum ground shaking intensity of  PEIS VII (Destructive). At PEIS VII, most people get frightened and run outdoors. People find it difficult to stand on the upper floors. Heavy objects and furniture overturn or topple. Trees are shaken strongly. Big church bells may ring. Old or poorly-built structures suffer considerable damage. Some well-built structures are slightly damaged. Some cracks may appear on dikes, fish ponds, road surfaces, or concrete hollow block walls. Liquefaction effects (e.g. subsidence, sand boils, lateral spreads, etc.) in low-lying areas and landslides in mountains are observed near the epicenter.

Total earthquake recorded: 228 (plotted- 118, felt-5) , Ranging from mag 1.6 - 5.2 from Aug 18- Aug 19 as of 6am. The following are the reported intensities:

Intensities	Areas Affected by the Intensities
Intensity VII-	Cataingan, Masbate
Intensity V- City of Masbate, Masbate; Almagro, and Tagapul-an, Samar
Intensity IV- Palanas, and San Jacinto, Masbate; City of Sorsogon, Sorsogon; City of Legazpi, Albay; San Andres, Quezon; Mapanas, and Palapag, Northern
Samar; Barugo, Dagami, Dulag, Julita, La Paz, Palo, and Tanauan, Leyte; City of Sagay, Negros Occidental
Intensity III-	City of Baybay, Isabel, Javier, and Kananga, Leyte; Ormoc City; Mulanay, Quezon; City of Iloilo
Intensity II- Guinayangan and Lopez, Quezon; President Roxas, Capiz; Patnongon, Patnongon, San Jose de Buenavista, and Tibiao, Antique
Intensity I- Lezo, Aklan; City of Dumaguete, Negros Oriental

67 houses were reported damaged (totally damaged - 31; partially damaged- 36) related to the 6.6 Magnitide Earthquake in Masbate. Cataingan District Hospital  Functional but with partial damaged (cracks on walling and floors). Passable but with damages in Brgy. Gahit, Cataingan, brgy. Nabangig,  Palanas and Brgy. Quezon Mun of Uson. Old Public Market Building in Cataingan is partially damaged.

Besides to the damages on houses, roads and structures in the most affected areas especially Municipality of  Cataingan, there were reported FLOODING in coastal barangay of  Matayum, Cataingan due to hightide and  subsidence by liquifaction& fault movement.

Also, the province of Masbate is still in  Modified General Quarantine Situation (MGCQ, pleasE refer to RP-IATF Omnibus Guidelines for the description of  quarantine situation in PH ) and currently with total of 19 confirmed cases of COVID and 5 of which is still active and under monitoring with 73.68% recovery rate with  no reported new case.
